name: OpenIDConnect

values.name: authorize
values.comment:
Build a Cmd that will redirect to the identity provider

Make sure to use withNonce

values.name: parse
values.comment: Extracts a Token from a location
values.type: Json.Decode.Decoder data -> Navigation.Location -> Result.Result OpenIDConnect.ParseErr (OpenIDConnect.Token data)

values.name: parseToken
values.type: Json.Decode.Decoder data -> String -> Result.Result OpenIDConnect.ParseErr (OpenIDConnect.Token data)

values.name: parseWithNonce
values.comment: Extracts a Token from a location and check the incoming nonce
values.type: String -> Json.Decode.Decoder data -> Navigation.Location -> Result.Result OpenIDConnect.ParseErr (OpenIDConnect.Token data)

values.name: showToken
values.comment: Returns the token as a string

values.name: tokenData
values.comment: Returns the data of a Token

values.name: tokenRaw
values.comment: Returns the raw encoded token as a string

values.name: use
values.comment: Use a token to authenticate a request.
values.type: OpenIDConnect.Token data -> List Http.Header -> List Http.Header

values.name: withNonce
values.comment:
Add a nonce to a Authorization (required)

If omitted, the authorize function will work but the openid-connect
protocol will not be respected.
See <http://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-core-1_0.html#ImplicitAuthRequest>

values.name: withParam
values.comment: Add additional querystring parameters to the authorize url

values.name: withScope
values.comment: Add a custom scope to a Authorization

values.name: withState
values.comment: Add a custom state to a Authorization

name: OpenIDConnect.Decode
comment:
Provide decoders for the most common JWT attributes

@docs expDecoder, subDecoder
